intro: Royena goetzei, commonly known as the white sedge, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Cyperaceae family, which includes sedges and grass-like plants. The plant is characterized by its tall, slender stems and small, white to pale blue flowers that bloom in clusters. It typically grows in wetlands and marshy areas, thriving in moist, nutrient-rich soils. Royena goetzei is often used in horticulture for its ornamental value and ability to stabilize soil in wet environments.
